doc.ContractDescription: REPAIR OF MCM PROPELLER SHAFT
HANDLE ASSY,RT TRN
THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO ADD "EACH" BEHIND THE QUANTITY AND ADD DODAAC FOR ALL NOT SEPARATELY PRICED SLINS FOR WAWF PURPOSES.

SULFUR ISOTOPE FRACTIONATIONS RECORDED IN THE ARCHAEAN AND EARLY PALEO-PROTEROZOIC SEDIMENTS DO NOT FOLLOW THE CONVENTIONAL MASS DEPENDENT RELATIONSHIP. OCCURRENCE OF THESE LARGE NON- MASS-DEPENDENT (NMD) ISOTOPE EFFECTS HAS BEEN BROADLY ATTRIBUTED TO THE NMD SULFUR ISOTOPE FRACTIONATION ASSOCIATED WITH SO2 ULTRAVIOLET PHOTOLYSIS, AND THE LATER ABSENCE OF THESE LARGE NMD FRACTIONATION SIGNALS IN SEDIMENTS YOUNGER THAN ~2.45GYR HAS BEEN INTERPRETED TO REFLECT FUNDAMENTAL CHANGES IN THE TERRESTRIAL SULFUR CYCLE AND IS REGARDED AS ONE OF THE MOST CONVINCING PIECES OF EVIDENCE FOR THE OXIDATION OF EARTH S ATMOSPHERE AROUND 2.32-2.45GA. THESE INTERPRETATIONS, HOWEVER, RELY ON OUR UNDERSTANDING OF THE MECHANISM OF NMD SULFUR ISOTOPE FRACTIONATIONS DURING SO2 PHOTOLYSIS, WHICH IS CURRENTLY VERY LIMITED. AS CONTINUING STUDIES REVEAL MORE AND MORE COMPLEXITIES OF NMD SULFUR ISOTOPE ANOMALIES PRESENT IN THE GEOLOGIC RECORDS, OUR INSUFFICIENT UNDERSTANDING ABOUT THE MECHANISMS OF NMD SULFUR ISOTOPE FRACTIONATIONS HAMPERS INFORMED QUANTITATIVE INTERPRETATIONS OF THESE GEOLOGICAL RECORDS. WE PROPOSE TO STUDY THE NON-MASS-DEPENDENT SULFUR ISOTOPE FRACTIONATIONS ASSOCIATED WITH SO2 UV PHOTOLYSIS USING TUNABLE LASER SPECTROSCOPIC METHODS. BUILDING ON THE EXISTING TUNABLE LASER SPECTROSCOPIC METHODS FOR D34S MEASUREMENTS OF SO2, WE PROPOSE TO DEVELOP NEW TUNABLE LASER SPECTROSCOPIC METHODS FOR DETERMINING D34S, D33S AND D36S OF SO2, AND CONCENTRATION, D34S AND D33S OF SO (AN IMPORTANT INTERMEDIATE SPECIES DURING SO2 UV PHOTOLYSIS). WE WILL THEN CONDUCT A SERIES OF BROADBAND LOW PRESSURE (0.01 TO 0.2 TORR) SO2 UV PHOTOLYSIS EXPERIMENTS USING A TWO-CHAMBER CYLINDRICAL PHOTOCELL WITH A DEUTERIUM LAMP. ONE CHAMBER WILL HOST A SHIELDING GAS TO AFFECT THE UV SPECTRUM ENTERING THE OTHER CHAMBER. IN THE OTHER CHAMBER, WE WILL MONITOR, IN REAL-TIME, D34S, D33S AND D36S OF RESIDUAL SO2 AS WELL AS CONCENTRATION, D34S AND D33S OF SO USING TUNABLE LASER SPECTROSCOPY. WE WILL CONDUCT EXPERIMENTS AT SEVERAL DIFFERENT UV WAVELENGTHS, SO2 CONCENTRATIONS, GAS TEMPERATURES, BATH GAS COMPOSITIONS, AND SHIELDING GAS COMPOSITIONS. WE AIM TO SYSTEMATICALLY QUANTIFY THE KEY FACTORS INFLUENCING NON-MASS-DEPENDENT SULFUR ISOTOPE FRACTIONATIONS ASSOCIATED WITH SO2 UV PHOTOLYSIS, AND THUS ADVANCE OUR UNDERSTANDING OF THE EXACT MECHANISM OF SULFUR ISOTOPE FRACTIONATION ASSOCIATED WITH SO2 UV PHOTOLYSIS. THIS PROPOSED STUDY CONSTITUTES NOT ONLY THE FIRST REAL-TIME IN SITU MONITORING OF THE EVOLUTION OF SULFUR ISOTOPE COMPOSITIONS OF SO2, BUT ALSO THE FIRST EXPERIMENTAL STUDY OF THE SULFUR ISOTOPE COMPOSITIONS OF SO DURING SO2 UV PHOTOLYSIS. IN CONJUNCTION WITH EXPERIMENTAL EFFORT, WE WILL ALSO CONSTRUCT QUANTITATIVE MODELS OF PHOTOLYSIS KINETICS TO BETTER INTERPRET THE EXPERIMENTAL RESULTS AND EXTRAPOLATE THEM TO GEOLOGICAL RECORDS. THIS RESEARCH WILL PROVIDE IMPORTANT INSIGHTS ON THE MECHANISM OF NON-MASS-DEPENDENT SULFUR ISOTOPE FRACTIONATION ASSOCIATED WITH SO2 UV PHOTOLYSIS, AND WILL ALLOW US TO QUANTITATIVELY INTERPRET THE VARIATIONS OF THE ISOTOPIC SIGNALS PRESERVED IN THE GEOLOGICAL RECORDS AND TO PUT QUANTITATIVE CONSTRAINTS ON THE EVOLUTION OF OXIDATION STATE OF EARTH S ATMOSPHERE WHICH IS STRONGLY COUPLED TO EARLY BIOLOGICAL EVOLUTION. MOREOVER, THE TLS METHODS FOR MULTIPLE SULFUR ISOTOPE ANALYSES WE PROPOSE TO DEVELOP CAN BE MODIFIED AS FLIGHT INSTRUMENTS TO CHARACTERIZE IN SITU THE SULFUR ISOTOPE COMPOSITIONS OF ATMOSPHERIC GASES AND SOLID SAMPLES ON MARS AND OTHER SOLAR SYSTEM OBJECTS (E.G. VENUS, IO). THEREFORE,THE PROPOSED RESEARCH IS HIGHLY RELEVANT TO RESEARCH EMPHASIS OF NASA EXOBIOLOGY PROGRAM: EARLY EVOLUTION OF LIFE AND BIOSPHERE, AND RESPONSES TO THE OBJECTIVES 2, 4 AND 7 OF ASTROBIOLOGY ROADMAP: MARS AND OUTER SOLAR SYSTEM EXPLORATION, INVESTIGATION OF THE EVOLVING RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN LIFE ON EARTH AND ITS ENVIRONMENT, AND FURTHER DEVELOPMENT OF MULTIPLE SULFUR ISOTOPE COMPOSITIONS AS BIOSIGNATURES.

SMASS: FOR MORE THAN A DECADE, THE SMALL MAIN-BELT ASTEROID SPECTROSCOPIC SURVEY (SMASS) HAS EXPLORED THE SPECTRAL PROPERTIES OF THE ASTEROID BELT. RECENTLY, SMASS HAS FOCUSED ON THE PROPERTIES OF NEAR-EARTH OBJECTS (NEOS) WHILE KEEPING THE SMASS ACRONYM. CURRENTLY SMASS IS PERFORMING NEAR-INFRARED SPECTRAL MEASUREMENTS WITH "SPEX" ON THE NASA IRTF 3M TELESCOPE. WE HAVE PUBLICLY RELEASED SPECTRA FOR>150 NEOS (-1 KM) HTTP://SMASS.MIT.EDULAND HAVE (WITHIN PAST 3 YEARS)>15 REFEREED PUBLICATIONS AND 2 STUDENT THESES. (LONGER TERM SMASS TOTALS:>50 REFEREED PUBLICATIONS; 6 THESES.] MOST RECENT SCIENTIFIC HIGHLIGHTS INCLUDE: PINPOINTING (COMPOSITIONALLY) THE INNER ASTEROID BELT AS A LIKELY SOURCE FOR THE LARGEST NEOS; METEORITES APPEAR TO BE MUCH MORE BROADLY DERIVED [VERNAZZA, BINZEL ET AL. NATURE 454, 858, 2008]. *CONSTRAINING THE SPACE WEATHERING PROCESS [VERNAZZA, BINZEL ET AL. NATURE 458, 993, 2009]. DETERMINING THAT POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS OBJECT 99942 APOPHIS IS COMPOSITIONALLY MOST ANALOGOUS TO LL CHONDRITE METEORITES (BINZEL ET AL. ICARUS 200, 480, 20091. EXTENDING ASTEROID TAXONOMY INTO THE NEAR-INFRARED; RELEASING A PUBLIC WEB TOOL FOR ASTEROID CLASSIFICATION (DEMEO, BINZEL ET AL. ICARUS, IN PRESS; HTTP://SMASS.MIT.EDULBUSDEMEOCLASS.HTML). SMASS-NEXT: SMASS IS POISED AND READY FOR THE NEXT GENERATION: A NEW STATE-OF-THE-ART "SPEX-LIKE" INSTRUMENT (CALLED "FIRE"; FUNDED BY THE NSF/MRI PROGRAM) IS COMING ONLINE (MID-2009) FOR THE MAGELLAN 6.5M TELESCOPE. "SMASS-NEXTLT WILL USE MAGELLAN+FIRE TO PUSH SPECTROSCOPY TO THE FAINTEST LIMITS (V>19.0) YET ACHIEVED IN NEO CHARACTERIZATION SURVEYS. RAPID PUBLIC RELEASE OF DATA WILL CONTINUE IN THE SMASS-NEXT PROGRAM. SCIENCE OBJECTIVES: OUR RESEARCH OBJECTIVES ARE DEFINED BY QUESTIONS AT THE FRONTIER OF CURRENT KNOWLEDGE OF THE NEO POPULATION, THEREBY OF INTRINSIC IMPORTANCE WITHIN PLANETARY SCIENCE: (I) HOW DOES THE COMPOSITIONAL DISTRIBUTION OF THE NEO POPULATION VARY WITH SIZE? (II) HOW WELL DO NEOS DIRECTLY COMPARE WITH THE POPULATION THAT APPEARS TO BE THEIR PREDOMINANT SOURCE; -1 KM ASTEROIDS IN THE INNER MAIN-BELT? (ILL) WHICH NEOS PROVIDE THE MOST SCIENTIFICALLY IMPORTANT DESTINATIONS FOR FUTURE EXPLORATION? (IV) WHAT IS THE NATURE OF THE POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS OBJECT (PHO) POPULATION? MERIT AND IMPACT: THE MERIT AND IMPACT OF OUR OBJECTIVES WILL BE TO UNRAVEL OBSERVATIONALLY, AND THEREBY TEST DIRECTLY, DELIVERY PROCESSES AND SOURCES FOR NEOS AND METEORITES. WE WILL ADDITIONALLY ADDRESS DIRECTLY THE POPULATION AND SOURCE OF PHOS. OUR RESULTS WILL IMPACT OUR UNDERSTANDING OF THE YARKOVSKY EFFECT", THE ROLE AND OUTCOMES OF ASTEROID COLLISIONS, AND THE DYNAMICS AND EFFECTIVENESS OF DELIVERY RESONANCES. OUR FINDINGS WILL TIE DIRECTLY TO STUDIES OF METEORITES AND THEIR LINKS TO PLANETARY FORMATION. FURTHER, WE WILL BE A PATHFINDER FOR FUTURE NEO MISSIONS FOR SAMPLE RETURN, HAZARDOUS OBJECT ASSESSMENT~ RESOURCE UTILIZATION, AND POSSIBLE HUMAN EXPLORATION. NEOO PROGRAMMATIC CAPABILITIES: WE PROPOSE TO ADD A SUBSTANTIAL NEW LARGE APERTURE ASSET (MAGELLAN 6.5M, LAS CAMPANAS, CHILE). IN THE SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE, FOR NEO CHARACTERIZATION. WE WILL INCREASE BY A FACTOR OF2X TO 3X NASA'S CURRENT SPECTROSCOPIC CHARACTERIZATION CAPABILITY FOR>I KM NEOS, FOR>140 M PHOS, AND FOR HIGHLY ACCESSIBLE SPACECRAFT DESTINATIONS. WE WILL CONTINUE UTILIZATION OF THE NASA IRTF FOR OBSERVABLE (V<17.5) NORTHERN HEMISPHERE TARGETS. OUR NEAR-IR SPECTRAL MEASUREMENTS WILL COMPLEMENT THE FAR-INFRARED WAVELENGTH RANGE OF THE WISE MISSION AND THE VISIBLE COLORS OF PAN-ST ARRS. CONCLUDING REMARKS: FUNDING OR REJECTION OF THIS PROPOSAL WILL DETERMINE THE CONTINUATION OR THE END OF THE MIT SMASS PROGRAM, ARGUABLY FULL TIME POSTDOCTORAL ASSOCIATE (PERSON TBD), ONE GRADUATE STUDENT, AND DATA ACQUISITION

THIS PROPOSAL RESPONDS TO ROSES13 A.46 (TERRA AND AQUA - ALGORITHMS - EXISTING DATA PRODUCTS) AND DESCRIBES FINAL MAINTENANCE AND REFINEMENT ACTIVITIES IN SUPPORT OF THE MODIS GLOBAL LAND COVER PRODUCT (MCD12). THIS PRODUCT CONSISTS OF TWO SUITES OF SCIENTIFIC DATA SETS: MCD12Q1 (GLOBAL LAND COVER TYPE) AND MCD12Q2 (GLOBAL LAND COVER DYNAMICS). COLLECTION 5 OF THE MCD12Q1 PRODUCT PROVIDES FIVE LAND COVER CLASSIFICATIONS, AND THE MCD12Q2 PRODUCT PROVIDES SEVEN DATA LAYERS THAT CHARACTERIZE THE LAND SURFACE PHENOLOGY OF GLOBAL ECOSYSTEMS. BOTH PRODUCTS ARE PRODUCED ANNUALLY AT 500-M SPATIAL RESOLUTION. FOR COLLECTION 6, WE ARE ADDING A NEW LAND COVER LAYER TO THE MCD12Q1 PRODUCT THAT IS COMPLIANT WITH THE FAO LAND COVER CLASSIFICATION SYSTEM, AND HAVE SIGNIFICANTLY REVISED THE MCD12Q2 ALGORITHM TO IMPROVE ITS ACCURACY AND REDUCE THE FREQUENCY OF MISSING DATA. UNFORTUNATELY, TESTING AND DEVELOPMENT OF COLLECTION 6 MCD12 PRODUCTS HAS BEEN IMPEDED BY DELAYS IN PROCESSING UPSTREAM INPUTS TO THE MCD12 ALGORITHMS. SPECIFICALLY, THE PRIMARY INPUT TO BOTH MCD12 ALGORITHMS IS THE LEVEL 3 MODIS NADIR BRDF-ADJUSTED SURFACE REFLECTANCE (NBAR) PRODUCT. COLLECTION 6 REPROCESSING FOR MODIS LAND PRODUCTS IS CURRENTLY SCHEDULED TO BEGIN IN LATE JULY 2013 AND WILL REQUIRE 6-9 MONTHS TO COMPLETE FOR LEVEL 1-3 LAND PRODUCTS. AS A RESULT, 1-3 YEARS OF NBAR DATA (WHICH ARE REQUIRED TO RUN AND TEST THE MCD12 COLLECTION 6 ALGORITHMS) WILL NOT BE AVAILABLE UNTIL LATE SEPTEMBER 2013, AND A FULL TIME SERIES REQUIRED FOR MCD12 (2000-PRESENT) IS NOT LIKELY TO BE AVAILABLE UNTIL DECEMBER 2013, AT THE EARLIEST. WE CURRENTLY ANTICIPATE THAT TESTING AND TUNING OF THE COLLECTION 6 ALGORITHMS FOR MCD12 WILL BE PERFORMED IN THE FALL OF 2013, BUT OPERATIONAL PRODUCTION OF COLLECTION 6 MCD12 PRODUCTS WILL NOT OCCUR UNTIL 2014. THE ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED IN THIS PROPOSAL ARE DESIGNED TO SUPPORT TWO MAIN GOALS. FIRST, WE PROPOSE TO PROVIDE SHORT-TERM MAINTENANCE AND REFINEMENT OF THE COLLECTION 6 MCD12 PRODUCT SUITE THROUGH 2014. HOWEVER, THE MCD12 PRODUCT SUITE IS UNIQUE AMONG THE LAND PRODUCTS BECAUSE IT IS GENERATED AT THE BOSTON UNIVERSITY SCIENTIFIC COMPUTE FACILITY. HENCE, THE SECOND GOAL OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO PORT ALL SOURCE CODE AND DATASETS USED TO GENERATE THE MCD12 PRODUCTS TO NASA'S MODIS ADAPTIVE PROCESSING SYSTEM (MODAPS), THEREBY ALLOWING LONG-TERM MAINTENANCE OF MCD12 PRODUCTS BY NASA. THE PRIMARY CHALLENGE TO ACHIEVING THESE GOALS IS ADEQUATE TESTING, MAINTENANCE, AND REFINEMENT OF COLLECTION 6 MCD12 PRODUCTS, WHICH WE HAVE NOT BEEN ABLE TO ACCOMPLISH BECAUSE OF DELAYS IN COLLECTION 6 REPROCESSING. TO ENSURE BOTH THE QUALITY OF THE PRODUCTS AND A SMOOTH TRANSITION TO OPERATIONAL PRODUCTION AT NASA, WE PROPOSE A 2-YEAR EFFORT DURING WHICH WE WILL MAINTAIN COLLECTION 6 OF THE MCD12 PRODUCT AND WORK CLOSELY WITH STAFF AT NASA GSFC TO MOVE OPERATIONAL PRODUCTION OF OUR ALGORITHMS FROM BOSTON UNIVERSITY TO NASA.
doc.MajorAgency: FINAL MAINTENANCE AND REFINEMENT OF THE MODIS LAND
doc.MajorFundingAgency: FINAL MAINTENANCE AND REFINEMENT OF THE MODIS LAND
